description: The Doomsday Clock has been set at 90 seconds to midnight again – but what does that really mean? Here's everything you need to know about today's announcement
maintext:
It is 90 seconds to midnight according to an infamous Doomsday Clock that predicts how close we are to Armageddon.
The Bulletin of Atomic Scientists, who developed the clock in the 1940s to gauge how near we are to end times, announced today (Tuesday, January 23) we are just as close as in 2023 to annihilation.
The time is determined not only by war and the threat of nuclear action, but also by climate change and the risks of artificial intelligence and disease. When it started all the way back in 1947 we were seven minutes from disaster. In 1991 we were as far away as 17 minutes, but in recent years with war in the Ukraine and increased tensions in the Middle East and North Korea we've been edging close.
title: Doomsday Clock still 90 seconds to midnight as we're 'closest we've ever been' to End Times
